snippet: Economists say uncertainty over tax increases and spending cuts set to take effect at the end of 2012 could be cutting into economic growth already.
abstract: Business leaders and policy makers are growing concerned, with the economy having slowed in recent weeks, that the tax increases and government spending cuts set to take effect at the end of 2012 have already begun to cause companies to hold back on hiring and investments; market index that economists consider to be a proxy for uncertainty--the Chicago Board Options Exchange Volatility Index--has risen more than 26 percent since April.
lead_paragraph: Economists say uncertainty over tax increases and spending cuts set to take effect at the end of 2012 could be cutting into economic growth already.

headline.seo: Looming Fiscal Cliff May Already Be Stalling Business Activity
headline.main: Fear of Year-End Fiscal Stalemate May Be Having Effect Now
headline.print_headline: Fear of Year-End Fiscal Stalemate May Be Having Effect Now
